docs.title: Eddy3D Modules
docs.text:
The Grasshopper plugin currently contains three modules, please see below.

  • Eddy3D Outdoor

    Decoupled microclimate simulations, via wind and mean radiant temperature simulations. Driven by OpenFOAM and Radiance.

    Learn more

  • Eddy3D Outdoor+

    Fully coupled microclimate simulations, including wind, radiation, heat, and moisture transfer, driven by urbanMicroclimateFoam by ETH Zurich Building Physics.

    Learn more

  • Eddy3D Indoor

    Modeling airflow, moisture content, and passive scalars in indoor spaces.

    Learn more

docs.text: Module Overview Core engine Rhino (ver) OS support OpenFOAM (ver) Radiance (ver) Other dependencies Docs Outdoor Decoupled microclimate (wind + mean radiant temp) OpenFOAM; Radiance 8.15 Win 10/11 8 Radiance 5.3 — Learn more Outdoor+ Fully coupled microclimate (wind, radiation, heat, moisture) OpenFOAM 8.15 Win 10/11 8 — urbanMicroclimateFoam Learn more Indoor Airflow, moisture, passive scalars (indoor) OpenFOAM 8.15 Win 10/11 8 - — Learn more

docs.title: Indoor Simulation
docs.text:
Indoor Airflow Solver

Simulates buoyancy-driven airflow, temperature distribution, and contaminant transport within an indoor space.

Uses OpenFOAM's 'buoyantSimpleFoam' solver. Requires connected walls, inlets, outlets, and optional heat sources.

Eddy3D 0.5.0.815

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
• Install Eddy3D
  • Install BlueCFD in the default folder:
  • For versions <= 0.3.8.0, please install BlueCFD 2017 in the default folder:
    • C:\Program Files\blueCFD-Core-2017
  • For versions >= 0.4.0.10, please install BlueCFD 2020 in the default folder:
    • C:\Program Files\blueCFD-Core-2020
  • If you would like to use the experimental MRT component, please install Radiance in the default folder: C:\Program Files\Radiance

docs.title: Templates
docs.text:
• Eddy comes with starter templates that you can find by right clicking on the Template component, see below.
  • Select a template of your choice and follow the enumerated markers through the canvas.

docs.title: Parallel computation
docs.text: There is currently an issues with Microsoft’s and BlueCFD’s MPI dll which is why a run with multiple CPUs might fail. You need both dlls to be the same file, see here for instructions on how to ensure that.

docs.title: ABL Flow
docs.text:
Atmospheric Boundary Layer (ABL) Inlet

Sets up a logarithmic wind profile based on aerodynamic roughness length (z0). Essential for accurate urban wind flow simulation, representing the friction of the upwind terrain.

Eddy3D 0.5.0.815

docs.title: Dir
docs.text: Wind directions to simulate. Units: degrees (0-359). 0° = North, 90° = East. Use multiple for annual studies.

docs.title: Uref
docs.text: Wind speed at reference height. Units: m/s. Typical urban: 3-8 m/s. Default: 5 m/s

docs.title: Zref
docs.text: Height where velocity is measured (weather station height). Units: m. Standard: 10m. Default: 10m

docs.title: Z0
docs.text: Aerodynamic roughness length. Units: m. Examples: 0.01 (open terrain), 0.3 (suburban), 1.0 (urban). Default: 1m

docs.title: Zgnd
docs.text: Minimum z-coordinate of terrain. Units: m. Usually 0 for flat terrain. Default: 0m

docs.title: EPW
docs.text: Optional: Path to EnergyPlus weather file (.epw) for climate-based wind data.

docs.title: BC
docs.text: Wind inlet boundary condition for Domain component

docs.text:
Analysis Period

Defines a specific time period for analysis (e.g., Summer from 9am-5pm). Outputs a list of hours (HOY) to filter simulation results for seasonal or daily studies.

docs.title: Box Domain
docs.text:
Rectangular Simulation Domain

Defines a box-shaped computational domain for the wind simulation. Best suited for single-direction wind analysis or wind tunnel comparisons.

Eddy3D 0.5.0.815

docs.title: Bldg
docs.text: Building geometry (Breps or Meshes). These create wall boundary conditions in the CFD mesh.

docs.title: Terr
docs.text: Optional: Ground surface geometry. Must extend beyond domain bounds. If omitted, a flat ground is assumed.

docs.title: Tree
docs.text: Optional: Tree/vegetation objects from Tree component. Creates porous zones for wind resistance.

docs.title: BC
docs.text: Wind inlet conditions from ABL Flow or Uniform Flow component. Defines wind speed, direction, and turbulence.

docs.title: Cell
docs.text: Base mesh cell size. Units: meters. Smaller = more accurate but slower. Typical: 5-20m. Default: 20m

docs.title: Len
docs.text: Domain length (wind direction). Units: meters. Recommend: 15-20x building height.

docs.title: Wid
docs.text: Domain width (cross-wind). Units: meters. Recommend: 10x building width.

docs.title: Hgt
docs.text: Domain height. Units: meters. Recommend: 5-6x tallest building height.

docs.text: CFD domain object for Wind Simulation component

docs.text: Domain boundary mesh for visualization

docs.title: Cylindrical Domain
docs.text:
Cylindrical Simulation Domain

Defines a cylindrical computational domain. Recommended for multi-directional wind analysis as it allows for changing wind directions without re-meshing.

Eddy3D 0.5.0.815

docs.title: Bldg
docs.text: Building geometry (Breps or Meshes). These create wall boundary conditions in the CFD mesh.

docs.title: Terr
docs.text: Optional: Ground surface geometry. Must extend beyond domain bounds. If omitted, a flat ground is assumed.

docs.title: Tree
docs.text: Optional: Tree/vegetation objects from Tree component. Creates porous zones for wind resistance.

docs.title: BC
docs.text: Wind inlet conditions from ABL Flow or Uniform Flow component. Can include multiple wind directions.

docs.title: Cell
docs.text: Base mesh cell size. Units: meters. Smaller = more accurate but slower. Typical: 5-20m. Default: 20m

docs.title: Inner
docs.text: Size of the inner rectangular region. Units: meters. Should contain all buildings.

docs.title: Outer
docs.text: Radius of the outer cylindrical boundary. Units: meters. Recommend: 5-6x tallest building height.

docs.title: Hgt
docs.text: Domain height. Units: meters. Recommend: 5-6x tallest building height.

docs.title: RadMult
docs.text: Controls radial mesh grading. Higher = more cells near center. Default: 2

docs.title: DivX
docs.text: Additional mesh refinement in X direction. Only visible after meshing. Default: 1

docs.text: CFD domain object for Wind Simulation component

docs.title: MRT Simulation
docs.text:
Mean Radiant Temperature (MRT) Solver

Calculates MRT, a key metric for thermal comfort, using ray-tracing and view factors. Combines: - Direct Solar Radiation - Diffuse Sky Radiation - Longwave Surface Emissions

docs.title: Mean Radiant Temperature
docs.text:
Mean Radiant Temperature.

This is based on a TwoPhaseDDS approach for which it is assumed that the building surface temperature equals the ambient temperature. We run a sky view factor analysis, followd by the TwoPhaseDDS method taking into account direct solar gain.

For large models or lots of probing points, it might take a moment until the commandline shows up. Please make sure Radiance is installed at: "C:\Program Files\Radiance".

Eddy3D 0.5.0.815

Controls the resolution and quality of the simulation grid (mesh). Adjust cell sizes to balance between simulation accuracy and computation time.

docs.title: Pedestrian Wind Comfort
docs.text:
Pedestrian Wind Comfort Analysis

Evaluates annual wind velocities to determine suitability for sitting, standing, or walking. Calculates maximum allowable exceedance probability based on wind statistics. Assumes probing height at 1.75m above ground.

General Lawson

1 - A > 1.8 m/s < 2 % Sitting Long 2 - B > 3.6 m/s < 2 % Sitting Short 3 - C > 5.3 m/s < 2 % Walking Leisurely 4 - D > 7.6 m/s > 5 % Walking Fast 5 - E > 7.6 m/s >= 2 % Uncomfortable

Lawson LDDC

1 - A > 2.5 m/s < 5 % Frequent sitting 2 - B > 4 m/s < 5 % Occasional sitting 3 - C > 6 m/s < 5 % Standing 4 - D > 8 m/s < 5 % Walking 5 - E > 8 m/s > 5 % Uncomfortable 6 - S > 15 m/s > 0.022 % Unsafe

Lawson 2001

1 - A > 4 m/s < 5 % Sitting 2 - B > 6 m/s < 5 % Standing 3 - C > 8 m/s < 5 % Strolling 4 - D > 10 m/s < 5 % Business Walking 5 - E > 10 m/s > 5 % Uncomfortable 6 - S15 > 15 m/s > 0.023 % Unsafe frail 7 - S20 > 20 m/s > 0.023 % Unsafe all

Davenport

1 - A > 3.6 m/s < 1.5 % Sitting Long 2 - B > 5.3 m/s < 1.5 % Sitting Short 3 - C > 7.6 m/s < 1.5 % Walking Leisurely 4 - D > 9.8 m/s < 1.5 % Walking Fast 5 - E > 9.8 m/s >= 1.5 % Uncomfortable 6 - S > 15.1 m/s >= 0.01 % Dangerous

NEN8100 Comfort

1 - A > 5 m/s < 2.5 % Sitting Long 2 - B > 5 m/s < 5 % Sitting Short 3 - C > 5 m/s < 10 % Walking Leisurely 4 - D > 5 m/s < 20 % Walking Fast 5 - E > 5 m/s > 20 % Uncomfortable 6 - S > 15 m/s > 0.05 % Dangerous

NEN8100 Safety

1 - A > 15 m/s < 0.05 % No Risk, 2 - B > 15 m/s < 0.3 % Limited Risk 3 - C > 15 m/s > 0.3 % Dangerous

Eddy3D 0.5.0.815

Computes the Universal Thermal Climate Index (UTCI), a measure of how the weather "feels" to the human body.

docs.title: UTCI Binning
docs.text:
Condition of person rating in bins. Order is as follows: < -40 = -5(extreme cold stress) - 40 to - 27 = -4(very strong cold stress) - 27 to - 13 = -3(strong cold stress) - 13 to 0 = -2(moderate cold stress) 0 to 9 = -1(slight cold stress) 9 to 26 = 0(no thermal stress) 26 to 28 = 1(slight heat stress) 28 to 32 = 2(moderate heat stress) 32 to 38 = 3(strong heat stress) 38 to 46 = 4(very strong heat stress)

46 = 5(extreme heat stress) Eddy3D 0.5.0.815

docs.title: Wind Factors
docs.text:
Wind Amplification Factors

Calculates the ratio between local wind speed and reference meteorological wind speed to identify areas of acceleration or shelter.

Based on collected data, this component calculates wind factors for each probing point [8760 hourly branches x number of probing points]. Factors are derived from wind velocity and direction for each hour, scaled by probing height. Supports either a look-up for the closest simulated wind direction or an interpolation between directions.

Eddy3D 0.5.0.815

docs.title: Output
docs.text:
Wind Amplification Factors (dimensionless wind velocity) for each simulated wind direction. This yields a datatree of the size [Number of simulated wind directions x number of sensor points]. * ##### WFA Wind Factors Annual

Wind Factors multiplied with the corresponding EPW wind velocity from the nearest simulated wind direction for every hour of the year. This yields a datatree of the size [8760 h x number of sensor points].

docs.text: Wind Amplification Factors Spatial

docs.title: Wind Factors2
docs.text:
Wind Factors2

Based on the probed simulation and the weather data, this component calculates wind velocities, wind factors for each probing point [8760 hourly branches x number of probing points]. The wind factors are calculated based on the wind velocity and direction for each hour which is scaled up/down accordingly given probing height from ground. For this, we support either a look-up for the closest simulated wind direction or an interpolation between the closest two wind directions.

docs.title: A Grasshopper plugin for microclimate simulations
docs.text: UMCF (urbanMicroclimateFoam) is an open-source solver for coupled physical processes modeling urban microclimate based on OpenFOAM.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
🌊 CFD - Solves turbulent, convective airflow - Handles heat and moisture transport in the air subdomain

🏗️ HAM - Manages absorption and transport - Controls storage of heat and moisture in porous building materials

☀️ RAD - Calculates net longwave and shortwave radiative heat fluxes - Uses view factor approach

🌳 VEG - Solves heat balance for urban trees - Handles green surfaces

docs.title: Acknowledgments
docs.text:
The plugin is based on the urbanMicroclimateFoam open-source solver based on OpenFOAM, developed by the Chair of Building Physics at ETH Zürich.

  • Github repository: https://github.com/OpenFOAM-BuildingPhysics/urbanMicroclimateFoam
  • Gitlab repository: https://gitlab.ethz.ch/openfoam-cbp/solvers/urbanmicroclimatefoam

This project is partially funded by Perkins&Will Research. Their support has been instrumental in advancing this tool.

This project originated from the VIP - Surrogate Models for Urban Regeneration during Fall 2024. Visit the documentation for more details and view the final presentation.

docs.title: Eddy3D - Outdoor+
docs.text: A Grasshopper plugin for urban microclimate simulation with urbanMicroclimateFoam (uMFoam)

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
urbanMicroclimateFoam (uMFoam) is an open-source solver built on OpenFOAM for modeling urban microclimates. It simulates coupled physical processes including:

  • Turbulent airflow
  • Heat and moisture transport in air
  • Radiative heat exchange (shortwave and longwave)
  • Heat and moisture storage in building materials (HAM model)
  • Urban vegetation heat balance

Learn more at the official repository: 🔗 urbanMicroclimateFoam GitHub

docs.title: 1. Install OpenFOAM with blueCFD-Core 2020 (Windows)
docs.text:
• Download: blueCFD-Core-2020-1-win64-setup.exe
  • This version includes OpenFOAM 8.

docs.title: 2. Install UMCF Plugin for Grasshopper (Rhino)
docs.text:
• Open Rhinoceros
  • Run the PackageManager command
  • Search for UMCF
  • Enable "Include pre-releases"
  • Click Install and restart Rhino

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
Use the Check Installation component in Grasshopper:

  • Set Check = True
  • Set Install UrbanMicroclimateFoam = True if it’s a new install

The console will automatically install the necessary files.

docs.title: 1. Load Template
docs.text:
• Use the Templates component
  • Right-click > select UMCF.Templates.MicroclimateSimulation.gh

docs.title: 2. Add Weather File
docs.text:
• Connect an EPW file to the Weather component
  • This enables time settings in the Timing component

docs.title: Air Region
docs.text:
Use the Air Region component to set:

  • ABL Conditions: Wind speed, height, direction
  • Domain Dimensions:
  • Cell Size
  • Front Add, Back Add, Sides Add, Top Add
  • Refinement Box Add

docs.title: Solid Region (Buildings)
docs.text:
Inputs:

  • Building mesh geometry
  • Material (default: Hamstad5Brick)
  • Mesh refinement (optional)
  • Indoor temperature (°C)

docs.title: Vegetation Region
docs.text:
Inputs:

  • Vegetation mesh
  • Leaf Area Density (LAD)
  • Vegetation properties
  • Mesh refinement (optional)

Default vegetation values are found in constant/air/vegetationProperties.

docs.title: Simulation Settings
docs.text:
Configure with the Simulation Settings component:

  • Number of CPUs (e.g., 10 recommended)
  • maxFluidIteration (higher = better resolution)

docs.title: Write and Run the Case
docs.text:
Use the UMCF Case component to prepare files and view logs.

  1. Prepare Simulation – generate mesh
  2. Run Simulation – execute solver

Run both steps with the same processor mode (single/parallel).

After simulation: - View results with .foam in ParaView - 0 folder = initial conditions - Output folders based on controlDict: - startTime = 0, endTime = 43200, deltaT = 3600 (i.e., 12 hours)

docs.title: Visualize Results (in Rhino/Grasshopper)
docs.text:
Use a quad mesh plane at desired height in the Probing section.

Probe for: - Temperature (T) - Velocity (U) - Humidity (w)

Steps:

  1. Generate mesh plane
  2. Click Run
  3. Enable Probing to load results
  4. Use Hour Slider to view time-based results

docs.title: Output Types
docs.text:
• Velocity (U)
  • Temperature (T)
  • Humidity (w)

Visualizations are available both in Grasshopper and ParaView.

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text: Visit the UMCF GitHub Issues page or reach out to your instructor/supervisor for support.

docs.title: Vegetation Mesh Settings
docs.text: Configure mesh refinement for vegetation regions. OutdoorPlus 0.0.20.0

docs.title: SurfMin
docs.text: Minimum surface refinement level. Optional; default is 3.

docs.title: SurfMax
docs.text: Maximum surface refinement level. Optional; default is 5.

docs.title: RegDistMin
docs.text: Outer distance for the lower region refinement level. Optional; default is 2.0.

docs.title: RegMin
docs.text: Lower region refinement level. Optional; default is 4.

docs.title: RegDistMax
docs.text: Inner distance for the higher region refinement level. Optional; default is 1.0.

docs.title: RegMax
docs.text: Upper region refinement level. Optional; default is 5.

docs.title: Mesh
docs.text: Mesh refinement settings for vegetation regions.

docs.title: Vegetation Properties
docs.text: Define vegetation property coefficients for canopy modeling. OutdoorPlus 0.0.20.0

docs.title: a1
docs.text: Stomatal resistance coefficient a1. Optional; default is 169.

docs.title: a2
docs.text: Stomatal resistance coefficient a2. Optional; default is 18.

docs.title: a3
docs.text: Stomatal resistance coefficient a3. Optional; default is 0.005.

docs.title: D0
docs.text: Stomatal resistance coefficient D0. Optional; default is 1.2.

docs.title: C
docs.text: Proportionality factor. Optional; default is 131.035.

docs.title: bP
docs.text: Turbulent production coefficient. Optional; default is 1.0.

docs.title: bD
docs.text: Turbulent destruction coefficient. Optional; default is 5.1.

docs.title: H
docs.text: Canopy height (H). Optional; default is 1.5.

docs.title: kc
docs.text: Radiation extinction coefficient (kc). Optional; default is 0.5.

docs.title: l
docs.text: Characteristic leaf length (l). Optional; default is 0.1.

docs.title: rsMin
docs.text: Minimum stomatal resistance (rsMin). Optional; default is 150.

docs.title: Rg0
docs.text: Global radiation at canopy top (Rg0). Optional; default is 800.

docs.title: Rl0
docs.text: Long-wave radiation at canopy top (Rl0). Optional; default is 350.

docs.title: EvapSides
docs.text: Number of evaporation sides. Optional; default is 1.

docs.title: MinCell
docs.text: Minimum cell size factor. Optional; default is 10.

docs.text: Vegetation properties as a Setting instance.
